verses.esv:
7   The fear of the LORD is the beginning of knowledge;
    fools despise wisdom and instruction.
verses.kjv: 7 The fear of the LORD is the beginning of knowledge: but fools despise wisdom and instruction.
verses.niv: 7 The fear of the Lord is the beginning of knowledge, but fools despise wisdom and discipline.

verses.esv: 14 The natural person does not accept the things of the Spirit of God, for they are folly to him, and he is not able to understand them because they are spiritually discerned.
verses.kjv: 14 But the natural man receiveth not the things of the Spirit of God: for they are foolishness unto him: neither can he know them, because they are spiritually discerned.
verses.niv: 14 The man without the Spirit does not accept the things that come from the Spirit of God, for they are foolishness to him, and he cannot understand them, because they are spiritually discerned.

verses.esv:
To the choirmaster. Of David.

14:1   The fool says in his heart, “There is no God.”
    They are corrupt, they do abominable deeds;
    there is none who does good.
verses.kjv: 1 The fool hath said in his heart, There is no God. They are corrupt, they have done abominable works, there is none that doeth good.
verses.niv: 1 The fool says in his heart, "There is no God." They are corrupt, their deeds are vile; there is no one who does good.

verses.esv: 26 If anyone thinks he is religious and does not bridle his tongue but deceives his heart, this person’s religion is worthless.
verses.kjv: 26 If any man among you seem to be religious, and bridleth not his tongue, but deceiveth his own heart, this man’s religion is vain.
verses.niv: 26 If anyone considers himself religious and yet does not keep a tight rein on his tongue, he deceives himself and his religion is worthless.

verses.esv: 18 For the word of the cross is folly to those who are perishing, but to us who are being saved it is the power of God.
verses.kjv: 18 For the preaching of the cross is to them that perish foolishness; but unto us which are saved it is the power of God.
verses.niv: 18 For the message of the cross is foolishness to those who are perishing, but to us who are being saved it is the power of God.

verses.esv:
2   A fool takes no pleasure in understanding,
    but only in expressing his opinion.
verses.kjv: 2 A fool hath no delight in understanding, but that his heart may discover itself.
verses.niv: 2 A fool finds no pleasure in understanding but delights in airing his own opinions.

verses.esv: 14:1 As for the one who is weak in faith, welcome him, but not to quarrel over opinions.
verses.kjv: 1 Him that is weak in the faith receive ye, but not to doubtful disputations.
verses.niv: 1 Accept him whose faith is weak, without passing judgment on disputable matters.

verses.esv:
11   A fool gives full vent to his spirit,
    but a wise man quietly holds it back.
verses.kjv: 11 A fool uttereth all his mind: but a wise man keepeth it in till afterwards.
verses.niv: 11 A fool gives full vent to his anger, but a wise man keeps himself under control.

verses.esv: 20 And he said, “What comes out of a person is what defiles him. 21 For from within, out of the heart of man, come evil thoughts, sexual immorality, theft, murder, adultery, 22 coveting, wickedness, deceit, sensuality, envy, slander, pride, foolishness.
verses.kjv: 20 And he said, That which cometh out of the man, that defileth the man. 21 For from within, out of the heart of men, proceed evil thoughts, adulteries, fornications, murders, 22 Thefts, covetousness, wickedness, deceit, lasciviousness, an evil eye, blasphemy, pride, foolishness:
verses.niv: 20 He went on: "What comes out of a man is what makes him 'unclean.' 21 For from within, out of men's hearts, come evil thoughts, sexual immorality, theft, murder, adultery, 22 greed, malice, deceit, lewdness, envy, slander, arrogance and folly.

verses.esv: 7 Do not be deceived: God is not mocked, for whatever one sows, that will he also reap. 8 For the one who sows to his own flesh will from the flesh reap corruption, but the one who sows to the Spirit will from the Spirit reap eternal life.
verses.kjv: 7 Be not deceived; God is not mocked: for whatsoever a man soweth, that shall he also reap. 8 For he that soweth to his flesh shall of the flesh reap corruption; but he that soweth to the Spirit shall of the Spirit reap life everlasting.
verses.niv: 7 Do not be deceived: God cannot be mocked. A man reaps what he sows. 8 The one who sows to please his sinful nature, from that nature will reap destruction; the one who sows to please the Spirit, from the Spirit will reap eternal life.

verses.esv: 13 No servant can serve two masters, for either he will hate the one and love the other, or he will be devoted to the one and despise the other. You cannot serve God and money.”
verses.kjv: 13 No servant can serve two masters: for either he will hate the one, and love the other; or else he will hold to the one, and despise the other. Ye cannot serve God and mammon.
verses.niv: 13 "No servant can serve two masters. Either he will hate the one and love the other, or he will be devoted to the one and despise the other. You cannot serve both God and Money."

verses.esv: 17 Repay no one evil for evil, but give thought to do what is honorable in the sight of all. 18 If possible, so far as it depends on you, live peaceably with all. 19 Beloved, never avenge yourselves, but leave it to the wrath of God, for it is written, “Vengeance is mine, I will repay, says the Lord.” 20 To the contrary, “if your enemy is hungry, feed him; if he is thirsty, give him something to drink; for by so doing you will heap burning coals on his head.” 21 Do not be overcome by evil, but overcome evil with good.
verses.kjv: 17 Recompense to no man evil for evil. Provide things honest in the sight of all men. 18 If it be possible, as much as lieth in you, live peaceably with all men. 19 Dearly beloved, avenge not yourselves, but rather give place unto wrath: for it is written, Vengeance is mine; I will repay, saith the Lord. 20 Therefore if thine enemy hunger, feed him; if he thirst, give him drink: for in so doing thou shalt heap coals of fire on his head. 21 Be not overcome of evil, but overcome evil with good.
verses.niv: 17 Do not repay anyone evil for evil. Be careful to do what is right in the eyes of everybody. 18 If it is possible, as far as it depends on you, live at peace with everyone. 19 Do not take revenge, my friends, but leave room for God's wrath, for it is written: "It is mine to avenge; I will repay," says the Lord. 20 On the contrary: "If your enemy is hungry, feed him; if he is thirsty, give him something to drink. In doing this, you will heap burning coals on his head." 21 Do not be overcome by evil, but overcome evil with good.

verses.esv:
8   It is better to take refuge in the LORD
    than to trust in man.
verses.kjv: 8 It is better to trust in the LORD than to put confidence in man.
verses.niv: 8 It is better to take refuge in the LORD than to trust in man.

verses.esv: 25 For the foolishness of God is wiser than men, and the weakness of God is stronger than men.
verses.kjv: 25 Because the foolishness of God is wiser than men; and the weakness of God is stronger than men.
verses.niv: 25 For the foolishness of God is wiser than man's wisdom, and the weakness of God is stronger than man's strength.

verses.esv: 21 For since, in the wisdom of God, the world did not know God through wisdom, it pleased God through the folly of what we preach to save those who believe.
verses.kjv: 21 For after that in the wisdom of God the world by wisdom knew not God, it pleased God by the foolishness of preaching to save them that believe.
verses.niv: 21 For since in the wisdom of God the world through its wisdom did not know him, God was pleased through the foolishness of what was preached to save those who believe.

verses.esv:
3   When a man’s folly brings his way to ruin,
    his heart rages against the LORD.
verses.kjv: 3 The foolishness of man perverteth his way: and his heart fretteth against the LORD.
verses.niv: 3 A man's own folly ruins his life, yet his heart rages against the LORD.

verses.esv:
26   Whoever trusts in his own mind is a fool,
    but he who walks in wisdom will be delivered.
verses.kjv: 26 He that trusteth in his own heart is a fool: but whoso walketh wisely, he shall be delivered.
verses.niv: 26 He who trusts in himself is a fool, but he who walks in wisdom is kept safe.

verses.esv: 19 For the wisdom of this world is folly with God. For it is written, “He catches the wise in their craftiness,”
verses.kjv: 19 For the wisdom of this world is foolishness with God. For it is written, He taketh the wise in their own craftiness.
verses.niv: 19 For the wisdom of this world is foolishness in God's sight. As it is written: "He catches the wise in their craftiness";

verses.esv:
4   Answer not a fool according to his folly,
    lest you be like him yourself.
5   Answer a fool according to his folly,
    lest he be wise in his own eyes.
verses.kjv: 4 Answer not a fool according to his folly, lest thou also be like unto him. 5 Answer a fool according to his folly, lest he be wise in his own conceit.
verses.niv: 4 Do not answer a fool according to his folly, or you will be like him yourself. 5 Answer a fool according to his folly, or he will be wise in his own eyes.

verses.esv:
15   The way of a fool is right in his own eyes,
    but a wise man listens to advice.
verses.kjv: 15 The way of a fool is right in his own eyes: but he that hearkeneth unto counsel is wise.
verses.niv: 15 The way of a fool seems right to him, but a wise man listens to advice.

verses.esv: 31 Let all bitterness and wrath and anger and clamor and slander be put away from you, along with all malice. 32 Be kind to one another, tenderhearted, forgiving one another, as God in Christ forgave you.
verses.kjv: 31 Let all bitterness, and wrath, and anger, and clamour, and evil speaking, be put away from you, with all malice: 32 And be ye kind one to another, tenderhearted, forgiving one another, even as God for Christ’s sake hath forgiven you.
verses.niv: 31 Get rid of all bitterness, rage and anger, brawling and slander, along with every form of malice. 32 Be kind and compassionate to one another, forgiving each other, just as in Christ God forgave you.

verses.esv:
9   The devising of folly is sin,
    and the scoffer is an abomination to mankind.
verses.kjv: 9 The thought of foolishness is sin: and the scorner is an abomination to men.
verses.niv: 9 The schemes of folly are sin, and men detest a mocker.

verses.esv:
15   Folly is bound up in the heart of a child,
    but the rod of discipline drives it far from him.
verses.kjv: 15 Foolishness is bound in the heart of a child; but the rod of correction shall drive it far from him.
verses.niv: 15 Folly is bound up in the heart of a child, but the rod of discipline will drive it far from him.

verses.esv:
16   One who is wise is cautious and turns away from evil,
    but a fool is reckless and careless.
verses.kjv: 16 A wise man feareth, and departeth from evil: but the fool rageth, and is confident.
verses.niv: 16 A wise man fears the LORD and shuns evil, but a fool is hotheaded and reckless.

verses.esv: 23 but we preach Christ crucified, a stumbling block to Jews and folly to Gentiles,
verses.kjv: 23 But we preach Christ crucified, unto the Jews a stumblingblock, and unto the Greeks foolishness;
verses.niv: 23 but we preach Christ crucified: a stumbling block to Jews and foolishness to Gentiles,
